byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

abstract: At a campaign stop in New Hampshire, Mitt Romney accuses President Obama of fostering divisiveness in America.
snippet: At a campaign stop in New Hampshire, Mitt Romney accuses President Obama of fostering divisiveness in America.
lead_paragraph: MILFORD, N.H. -- Mitt Romney on Monday accused President Obama of fostering divisiveness in America and said the protests against Wall Street were unfairly criticizing an entire sector of the country's economy.

headline.main: Romney Turns Again to the Economy
